1ddfa8b19ee56419.title: Database Engineer / Developer
1ddfa8b19ee56419.description:
FIRM OVERVIEW:
Hall Capital Partners is an independent, privately owned SEC-registered investment advisor that builds and manages multi-asset class global investment portfolios for families, endowments, and foundations. As of March 31, 2019, we direct more than $34.3 billion of investment assets for our clients and a platform of pooled vehicle investors. Founded in 1994, our approximately 170 employees operate from offices in San Francisco and New York. We are typically responsible for investment strategy, asset allocation, and portfolio construction for globally diversified investment portfolios. The firm has a 25-year record of building and managing global investment portfolios and has established a strong reputation as a successful investor and partner. Our culture is centered on integrity, intellectual rigor, curiosity, client focus, performance, and fulfillment of our fiduciary responsibilities.

Hall Capital Partners is committed to attracting, retaining, engaging, and developing a pool of talent that is diverse along many dimensions. We seek to leverage these diverse experiences, backgrounds and viewpoints to best serve the needs of our clients.
Avoid the confidence gap: you do not have to match all the listed requirements exactly to apply. Hall Capital believes that our organization and culture is made stronger through diverse perspectives and experiences.

POSITION TITLE:
Database Engineer / Developer
The Database and System Architect/Engineer will report to the Vice President and Managing Director of IT. This position will work primarily with the IT Development group to increase efficiencies in various reporting and business needs as well as maintain business systems infrastructure. This position is responsible for analyzing, maintaining, developing and improving database architecture, especially when it relates and interacts with outside vendor data and systems. This role requires monitoring, troubleshooting, and enhancements to production database jobs.
This is an excellent opportunity to join a world class organization whose values of RESULTS, INTENSITY, TRANSPARENCY, AND CREATIVITY speak to the culture of our organization.

RESPONSIBILITIES OVERVIEW:
Develop data process flows to improve Hall Capital Partners business systems infrastructure
Improve and maintain architecture for reporting and business needs
Work with internal and external stakeholders to gather requirements and resolve issues
Manage internal Intranet and web apps
Resolve day to day data requests
Find solutions to requests and issues involving database and systems needs

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Four year Bachelor’s degree; computer science or science engineering degree preferred
0-5 years of work experience
Experience and discretion in handling sensitive and confidential information
Proficient in MS Office including Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of SQL Server Skills; including integration
Familiarity of C#, Javascript, .Net framework a plus
Experienced knowledge of Team Foundation Services Source Control
Superior interpersonal skills and ability to positively interact with all levels within an organization
Able to prioritize and respond quickly to immediate, time-sensitive requests.
Ability to work effectively and productively with others on a team and train others when needed
Have a “client-centric” mentality; be adept at anticipating the needs of others
Possess excellent organization skills
Have a strong work ethic

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES:
Respectful and professional
Efficient
Intellectually curious; able to problem solve
Independent and team-oriented. Works independently but functions effectively as part of the team
Ability to work under the pressure of a deadline-driven environment
Quick self-starter who can work with different personalities and professional styles
Self-motivated
Solutions-oriented
Results-driven. Be accountable for all tasks and possess follow-through and the ability to complete assigned tasks autonomously
Detail-oriented
Energetic, creative, and positive
Collaborative and flexible
Highly developed sense of integrity and commitment to client confidentiality and client satisfaction
Proactive team player with a positive, can-do attitude
Reliable and prompt attendance on a daily basis
Excellent attention to detail; take strong ownership over the accuracy of every deliverable

APPLICATION DETAILS:
Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until July 15, 2019.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
This job requires employee to sit for approximately 6-7 hours a day and use a keyboard and mouse for repetitive motion. There will be up to 15 lbs. to lift, push, or pull in this job.

Hall Capital Partners is an equal opportunity employer continually seeking to diversify its staff and will consider all qualified applicants with criminal history in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Fair Chance Ordinance of San Francisco.

54f9c857d240ac9e.title: Business Development Product Specialist, Google Play
54f9c857d240ac9e.description:
Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in a Business Development, Product Management, Product Specialist or similar role working with product teams in a mobile context.
3 years of experience in the mobile apps or games industry.

Preferred qualifications:

MBA or other relevant advanced degree or relevant military experience.
Knowledge of and interest in mobile app development and related topics.
Success working within cross-functional PM/engineering teams to scope requirements, identify good product-market fit and roll out new product features and capability through go-to-market teams.
Ability to analyze research or performance data, develop insights and apply those insights to optimize business development and product strategy.
Demonstrated leadership skills, with ability to both develop creativity and drive operational process and discipline.
Excellent communication skills and collaborative working approach.
About the job
Product Specialists bridge the gap between Product and Partners and work with BD Managers to solicit partner feedback to help inform product roadmaps. Product Specialists help build the value proposition and articulate product market fit for our partners. As a Product Specialist with the Google Play BD team at Google Play, you will partner with Play and Android’s Product and Engineering teams for a specific area of focus which may include: the Google Play Store (across multiple surfaces such as Mobile, Tablet and Chrome OS) and the Android platform. You will act as a subject matter expert (SME) on developers, their business needs and technical challenges to synthesize and prioritize critical developer feedback to help ensure that our product teams have the input they need to create products with maximum developer and end user value.
Google Play offers music, movies, books, apps and games for your devices, powered by the cloud. It’s a Google approach to entertainment, syncing magically across devices and on the web. On the Android and Mobile team, Googlers working on Google Play do everything from engineering backend systems, to shaping the product strategy, to forming great content partnerships. They make it possible for people to do things like buy an ebook or song on their Android phone, then have it instantly available on their laptop. The Google Play team helps strengthen the Android ecosystem by giving developers and partners a premium store where they can reach millions of users.
Responsibilities
Create a point of view on a particular product’s fit among a category or region of developers and help devise partner lists alongside Product and Business Development.
Use partner feedback to help inform product roadmaps and launch decisions.
Attend strategic partner meetings alongside Business Development Manager colleagues.
Deliver team-wide communications and training about the product roadmap, features and rollout plans for an assigned area.
Work with cross-functional teams such as Developer Marketing and Developer Relations to create compelling product narratives that educate and enable Play BD Managers to effectively bring new platforms, products and features to our developer partners.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

c13c73d853d4951d.title: UI Architect
c13c73d853d4951d.description:
At Delta Dental, our strategy is only as strong as the people who execute it! We are hiring individuals that are not just right for today but also for our future. We have built a foundation of high-trust by treating all people with dignity, making and keeping commitments, and consistently striving to do the right thing. Our leaders optimistically share future possibilities to inspire and motivate others toward their full potential. We expect our employees to find ways to embrace positive change, be curious and challenge the status quo, and provide solutions to unmet problems. Joining Delta Dental means joining a culture focused on fostering development, building genuine connections, recognizing each other’s strengths and sharing in successes.

We are looking for a self-starter Architect - Web App Engineering with impressive leadership skills and excellent technical chops to help us build our Next Gen Consumer Applications Suite.

How you will make an impact:
Design, develop and maintain responsive web applications providing awesome user experiences on desktop and mobile devices. This a hands-on leadership role to help build delightful customer experience with utmost attention to scalability, security and performance.
Be part of an engineering team that builds and supports amazing customer-facing products that will drive the next generation of Delta Dental Digital Experience.
Coach and mentor engineers in the org to build high quality, high performance reusable components.
Your primary focus will be architecting and designing next generation applications and modernizing current applications, ensuring high performance and responsiveness.
Lead the charge, communicate with customers and deliver high performing, resilient and intuitive suite of applications that create awesome customer experiences.
You will work and collaborate with cross-functional team of product managers, UX designers, architects, developers and automation engineers on our agile team.
Demonstrate that you’ve built outstanding consumer websites from concept to launch.
Continuous learning to stay current with the changing JavaScript ecosystem landscape.
An abundant desire to achieve perfection, but also a readiness to necessarily compromise.
What we look for:
BS/MS in computer science or equivalent work experience.
10+ years of experience designing and developing secure consumer-facing web applications.
Advanced level knowledge of JavaScript and Functional Programming.
4+ years of extensive experience building production application with Node.JS.
5+ years of Full Stack Front-end experience. Solid understanding of HTML5 and CSS3.
Proficient in building and consuming of Restful Web service, JSON based request response.
4+ years of experience working with popular JavaScript tools and Frameworks (like Gulp/npm, ejs/handlebar or Angular,js or React/Redux or Ember). ReactJS is preferred.
Experience building responsive Isomorphic Web Applications.
Expert level understanding of design principles to build a scalable application.
Expert level experience with the design and implementation of low-latency, high-availability and performant applications.
Proficient with writing unit test case using any of the testing framework like Mocha, Chai, Jasmine etc.
Experience with Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
Proficiency with Chrome and/or other browser Developer Tools.
Proficiency with Git/Github or other distributed version control systems.
Proficiency in user-centered design, progressive enhancement and graceful degradation, accessibility, SEO, responsive design, and website performance.
Experience with Scrum, Agile Process
Understanding of Relational, No SQL databases.
Experience with distributed cache like Redis.
Contributions to open source projects.
Experience with Linux environment & container technology such as docker.
Experience with logging tools like Splunk or ELK.
Experience with APM tool such as AppDynamics.
Experience using CI/CD tools like Jenkins and Chef.
Benefits and perks:
12 days starting vacation plus 11 holidays and your birthday off!
Multiple medical insurance options: 100% paid or low cost premiums
100% paid dental insurance
100% paid vision insurance
Onsite gym and/or gym discount and fitness incentive
Culture of learning: substantial tuition reimbursement to improve your skills
Career growth: we love promoting from within
Strong commitment to work/life balance
Technology allowance
Social responsibility and volunteer opportunities
At Delta Dental we:
Promote accountability, integrity and collaboration: Our employees are collaborative, self-aware, and ethical. It is our expectation to do the right thing and follow through on commitments.
Foster professional development: Our employees take ownership of developing self and others through coaching, mentoring and providing/being open to constructive feedback and identifying learning opportunities.
Value customers and cultivate positive experiences: Our employees take time to build rapport with customers, while anticipating and exceeding their needs to ensure positive outcomes.

If you think this sounds like you, let’s chat. We would love to tell you more!

Follow us @lifeatDDins on Instagram, lifeatDDins on Facebook, @lifeatDDins on Twitter

ABOUT Delta Dental
Delta Dental covers more Americans than any other dental benefits provider. As an employee you’ll take part in our mission to become the trusted health partner by collaborating with our communities and employees to reimagine and deliver new possibilities in an ever-changing environment. Our Enterprise Strategy focuses on pillars of Growth and Diversification, supported by the platforms of Culture and People, Process and Technology. Our employees take pride working for a purpose-driven organization and live our values of Trust, Service, Excellence and Innovation.

We are part of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of companies that provides dental coverage to 74 million people in the U.S. Delta Dental of California, Delta Dental of New York, Inc., Delta Dental of Pennsylvania and Delta Dental Insurance Company, together with our affiliate companies, form one of the nation’s largest dental benefits delivery systems, covering 33 million enrollees. All of our companies are members, or affiliates of members, of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of 39 Delta Dental companies throughout the country.

Delta Dental provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Delta Dental complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. 315b50eca82bc4b5.description:
Overview:
Wells Fargo technology teams drive innovation to create a more powerful and fulfilling financial experience for our customers and team members. You will join more than 24,000 team members supporting 95 billion transactions annually in 10 countries. Our career opportunities span the technology spectrum: advanced analytics, big data, information security, application development, cloud enablement, project management and more.

SUCCESS PROFILE
Check out the top traits we're looking for and see if you have the right mix. Additional related traits listed below.

Analytical
Detail-oriented
Insightful
Inventive
Problem Solver
Curious
Benefits
Wells Fargo wants to help you get more out of life and take care of things outside the office to make life a little easier. We provide:

Medical, Dental and Vision
Employer Matching 401(k)
Tuition Reimbursment
Maternity and Paternity Leave
Paid Time Off
Responsibilties
Job Description
At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed financially. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.
Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
Wells Fargo Technology sets IT strategy; enhances the design, development, and operations of our systems; optimizes the Wells Fargo infrastructure footprint; provides information security; and enables continuous banking access through in-store, online, ATM, and other channels to Wells Fargo’s more than 70 million global customers.
The Digital Channels Technology group (DCT) within Wells Fargo is the driving creative and technical force behind Wellsfargo.com and Mobile Apps. DCT helps customers realize their financial needs by delivering the world's most innovative e-banking and e-commerce services, capabilities, and alliances.
We are looking for a Senior Android Developer who can work on the next generation Android Mobile Apps and is an expert in Android Development. You will be directly involved in designing, developing and maintaining the Wells Fargo Mobile Apps. You will be working with Product Managers, UI/UX Designers, Backend and Frontend developers to build new features and enhance the Wells Fargo Mobile Apps.

The Android Developer will contribute new ideas to improve processes, practices and style. Android Developers are given the opportunity to innovate and experiment with new technology, participate in Contests & Hackathons, and encouraged to present work to other organizations.

Required Qualifications

7+ years of application development and implementation experience
5+ years of Android development experience
5+ years of Java experience
5+ years of RESTful or SOAP web services
5+ years of mobile platforms experience
5+ years of SDLC (System Development Life Cycle) experience


Desired Qualifications

Good verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Knowledge and understanding of test driven application development
Ability to design, develop, and implement large scale/complex software applications
Knowledge and understanding of design and development of modern web applications and mobile technologies


Other Desired Qualifications
Experience using Design Patterns in Mobile Applications like MVC, MVVM.
Solid understanding of the Android Ecosystem.

Street Address
CA-SF-South Of Market Area: 45 Fremont Street - San Francisco, CA

08d39618718f6f8e.title: Frontend Engineer, Applications
08d39618718f6f8e.description:
Hello! I’m the hiring manager for this role. Before I get into the usual job information, I want to share two reasons I’m proud to work here.

A single engineer can make a big difference. From extracting React components for reusability, formalizing CSS naming conventions, adding support for persistence operations to the new microservices framework, implementing infinite scroll… Countless initiatives with impacts across the entire organization have been thought up, debated, and implemented without red tape.

Even having been through similar sessions at past companies, I found the inclusivity training at Box to be uncommonly poignant and actionable. The people here are genuine in their efforts to welcome everyone and are supported by leadership. And when one of us fails--even accidentally, we call out the marginalizing behavior even if it's uncomfortable to do so.

Okay, here’s the rest:
Box powers how the world works together.

Box is much more than cloud file storage. We’re building features that enable companies to drive complex workflows from within Box, but that all begins with getting the basic building blocks right. We have openings on two of the teams that are building vital capabilities for the next generation of Box’s product lines: Tasks & Notifications and Personalization

Tasks & Notifications : Todo lists, cross-platform push notifications, integration with user-created workflows (think Zapier or IFTTT, but within Box), and more.

Personalization : Solving "folder sprawl" means helping our users find and organize content in a way that suits them, while also not making it harder for others on their team to accomplish their individual goals.

We’re already the undisputed leader in enterprise file sync and share, so companies store their files and collaborate using Box. These teams are part of an evolution towards moving business processes related to those files inside of Box. It’s all part of our mission to help companies get work done .

As a Frontend Engineer on one of these teams, you will...

Be part of the creative process. Story mapping, design review, meeting with customers and sales, and more
Collaborate with the Product and Design teams and ultimately build front-end components with React and CSS
Learn, influence, and adapt in order to work effectively with other teams and groups
Invest in the growth of your fellow engineers through mentorship, coaching, and sponsorship

What are the job requirements?

This is an onsite role at our headquarters in Redwood City, CA .
You should have 2 years of experience doing the following work. (More is fine, a little less might also be fine.)

Using APIs to build web UIs (React, Angular, Vue, etc)
Implementing and using monitoring processes to gauge the health and performance of a web application

Your experience does not need to match the specific technologies exactly.
You should be able to talk in depth about times during your career when you took initiative.

Learn more about Box Engineering here

Immerse yourself in the Box Platform: Create a developer account at developer.box.com
Box Engineers share on opensource.box.com
Get under the hood, comment on your favorite architecture deep-dive at tech.blog.box.com
Grab a free account and make your content more valuable: Hit us up at box.com

And please do take a look at some of the ways we celebrate difference at Box .

0465bbd7efe20a3b.title: Software Engineer - Full Stack, Delta Pipelines
0465bbd7efe20a3b.description:
Role Overview

We are seeking a full stack developer with expertise in front-end UI development, backend and test automation in continuous integration/deployment environment. In this role, your primary responsibility will be UI development, but you'll often find yourself working at different levels of the stack in order to pull off various features. You will work closely with the architect, product manager and customers to determine the requirements and design the front end which will be the entry point for customers to define their pipelines and help them monitor various aspects of the execution. You'll also be responsible for debugging and delivering the best possible application performance and adopting the best testing practices to help you find and fix bugs early.

Mission

The mission of this team is to enable customers to successfully deploy, test & upgrade pipelines and eliminate operational burdens for managing and building high quality data pipelines. The UI is critical to the success of this product as it sets the tone for the simplicity and intuitiveness of configuring these pipelines and monitoring them.

Outcomes


Collaborate with the product Manager, architect and customers to build and enhance features, developing from static mockups to fully working responsive experiences.
Build a configurable multi-tenant cloud-based web application that enables customers to define and launch pipelines.
Build real-time notifications to monitor the execution of streams.
Have a high standard of code quality & testing.

Qualification


3+ years of experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Passion for user experience and design and the small details.
Deep understanding of front-end architecture.
Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue).
Strong familiarity with server-side web technologies (eg: Nodejs, Java, Python, Scala).
Experience instrumenting user behaviors and interactions.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work well with teammates.
Passionate about your customers. You want to work with them and develop an amazing experience for them

Benefits


Medical, dental, vision
401k Retirement Plan
Unlimited Paid Time Off
Catered lunch (everyday), snacks, and drinks
Gym reimbursement
Employee referral bonus program
Awesome coworkers
Maternity and paternity plans

About Databricks

Databricks' mission is to accelerate innovation for its customers by unifying Data Science, Engineering and Business. Founded by the original creators of Apache Spark™, Databricks provides a Unified Analytics Platform for data science teams to collaborate with data engineering and lines of business to build data products. Users achieve faster time-to-value with Databricks by creating analytic workflows that go from ETL and interactive exploration to production. The company also makes it easier for its users to focus on their data by providing a fully managed, scalable, and secure cloud infrastructure that reduces operational complexity and total cost of ownership. Databricks, venture-backed by Andreessen Horowitz, NEA and Battery Ventures, among others, has a global customer base that includes Viacom, Shell, and HP. For more information, visit www.databricks.com ( https://databricks.com ).

Apache, Apache Spark and Spark are trademarks of the Apache Software Foundation ( http://www.apache.org/ ).

6c11896172289e99.title: Digital Consultant 2 - UX Visual Designer
6c11896172289e99.description:
Job Description
At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed financially. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.
Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
The Payments, Virtual Solutions, and Innovation (PVSI) team includes Operations, Consumer Credit Card, Retail Services, Consumer Deposits, the Innovation Group, Treasury Management, Merchant Services and Wells Fargo Virtual Channels and the professional services teams that partner with these businesses. PVSI's focus is on delivering the next generation of payments and deposit capabilities and advancing our digital and online offerings to design new customer experiences and products. Our guiding principles are to start with the customer, move faster, and partner effectively.
The Customer Experience Design (CXD) team of Wells Fargo is responsible for defining and delivering the B2B customer experience and standards for our enterprise API portal, the Gateway Developer Portal®. The Gateway platform leverages a responsive front-end framework system that delivers API and SDK solutions to commercial banking customers, as well to the enterprise bank itself.
The Visual Design team seeks an experienced junior- to mid-level UX Visual Designer to join our cross-functional UX team, to work on our web-based applications and iOS and Android mobile applications. Candidates should identify strongly as a visual designer, with equally strong brand and interaction design chops. Also, we desire applicants who are naturally adaptable, organized, and a collaborative problem solver. You’re comfortable and confident in your abilities to produce iterative comps, mocks, and high-to- low-fidelity prototypes.
A portfolio is required for this position, reflective of your ability to apply visual brand elements like typography, layout, iconography, and color elements to digital, B2B applications. Your portfolio should reflect excellent visual UX design, as well as demonstrate your ability to redline and create complex specs, and work with an established system of design system components and standards.
We’re a diverse array of people who are passionate about User Experience and creating simple, human-centered experiences. We embrace creativity, a strongly collaborative environment, and intellectual curiosity, as well as an enthusiasm for proactive communication, best practices in our work, and upholding our brand and UX standards. We’re looking for the same in you: a flexible and resilient collaborator with a sense of humor and humble confidence.
Responsibilities & Duties
Create meticulous, on-time deliverables such as high- and low-fidelity brand expression concepts, comps or mocks, redlines and specs that adhere to corporate brand strategy, accessibility and UX standards.
Produce on-brand visual design that motivates and guides our customers through their application experience and workflow.
Possess an eagle eye for typographic detail, color work, layout, and thoughtful adherence to design fundamentals.
Proactive collaboration with our cross-functional UX, Customer Insights, and Development teams, according to defined processes.
Be able to embrace grace under pressure, as needed through all stages of Design Sprints.
Solid verbal and written communication skills, and ability to present visual design work in meeting reviews and cross-functional sprints; demonstrate friendly, articulate communication of your work and design decisions. Listen to feedback and iterate to improve.
Meet and exceed best practices and standards, measurable impacts, and design integrity in the final digital product.

Required Qualifications

3+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: digital customer experience, digital product/program management, digital platforms, or digital consulting


Other Desired Qualifications
4+ years demonstrated experience designing for responsive, web-based applications, using an established framework design system.
4+ years proven visual design skills in typography, color, layout and brand.
Proven experience designing for mobile and native screens, iOS and Android screens.
Experience working within established visual design principles and visual design style guides
Familiarity with interface elements, states, and transitions, and how to style and define them to enhance user experience.
Expert skills in design and prototyping applications including Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, and InVision
Strong portfolio of visual design work for the above. Design documentation samples are required (example: redlines, style guides, design iterations or versions).
Ability to thrive in collaborative team environments
Ability to multi-task and work under pressure while retaining careful attention to detail
Solid knowledge of CSS as it relates to visual design
BA/BS degree in design or a related field.
Experience with Confluence and JIRA or similar collaboration and task applications.
Experience with or awareness of design for accessibility.
Illustration skills for infographics and iconography

Disclaimer

All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.

Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.

Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

a99633e3e0ddb647.title: Staff Engineer, Front-End Performance
a99633e3e0ddb647.description:
Minted is looking for a Front-End Engineer to join our newly-formed Latency Engineering team. Latency Engineering provides a central resource for managing site performance across the entire organization. If you join this team, you will be leading projects to improve the performance of Minted's software application stack.
You will:
Reduce apparent site latency for the end user
Increase SEO rankings by providing a faster site for search engine indexing
Improve scalability to manage site speed, accounting for geographic/seasonal differences
Hold the line on site performance during development and release cycles
Determine the critical site performance metrics that impact user satisfaction
Engage with application teams during project planning, providing analysis and guidance to help teams achieve latency targets
Propose and prototype library optimizations used by engineering teams across the company
Research, architect, build and operationalize performance gates in our CI/CD system
You are:
Obsessive about creating beautiful responsive web experiences
Up to speed with the latest web technologies and industry best practices
Highly collaborative in working style and an effective communicator
Able to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner
Not afraid of getting into the weeds and doing the work yourself, if needed
You have:
6+ years professional experience as a software developer (3+ years front-end)
Deep understanding of how to create high performance and highly accessible UXs
Strong programming skills in JavaScript on both the frontend and backend
Experience with a modern UI/application framework (React, Ember, Angular)
Experience designing scalable web applications and predicting scope and risks
Passion for simplicity, code craftsmanship, and design
A healthy appetite for disruptive innovation
BS or equivalent experience
Bonus:
Experience in tuning latency for bounce rate and SEO purposes
Experience with Node.js, React.js, and Redux
Experience with Linux performance tools (perf analysis)
Experience with Python, Java
Experience with TensorFlow, Caffe2, or PyTorch
Stream processing system experience like Spark Streaming, Cloud Dataflow, Apache Flink, Apache Beam
About Minted

Minted is a design platform whose mission it is to bring the best in independent design to consumers everywhere. The company's art, stationery, and textiles products have reached over 40 million homes worldwide.

Minted uses technology to bring unique, best-selling design to market at scale. Using its crowdsourcing technology, consumers are empowered to vote for the designs they love and want to see sold, ensuring that Minted always sells continuously fresh and trend-forward product. The winning designs are manufactured by Minted, enabling artists from around the world to share and sell their work while letting Minted do the rest. Since launch in 2007, the company has expanded to serve consumers in new categories including wall art, textiles, digital content and home decor, as well as serve major retailers and consumer products brands with data-backed design through licensing and wholesale partnerships.

Minted is headquartered in San Francisco, CA and currently employs 350+ full-time employees plus additional temporary workers during the holiday season. The company has raised over $300M from top-tier investors including Benchmark Capital, T. Rowe Price, Permira, Ridge Ventures, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Norwest Venture Partners. Angel investors include Marissa Mayer, Jeremy Stoppelman, Julia & Kevin Hartz, Yishan Wong, and more.

Minted is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives and will consider for employment all qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Minted participates in the E-verify program.

5b17264cfdc8eff8.title: Senior Software Engineer, Innovation
5b17264cfdc8eff8.description:
Job Description

Visa Innovation Center focuses on building technology for the next generation of payments. We work on solving hard problems of the future in IoT, Blockchain, Mobile, UX, Machine Learning, and Data Analytics. We are looking for hands-on expert level software engineers to help us build some innovative products.
This role requires quick problem solving skills, logical thinking, and application of programming techniques to design, build, and maintain code. Deep knowledge of computer science fundamentals, data structures, and algorithms is a must. In addition to the technical skill set, the candidate will be a self-starter, results-driven, and equipped with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
The Sr. Software Engineer is an individual contributor role, and this developer will lead development of several innovation projects. These projects will be instrumental in making an impact on Visa and the payments industry as a whole.

Qualifications

Bachelor or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related discipline
3 years of engineering management / leadership experience leading a team of software engineers
Expert level skills in Java / C# / C++
In-depth knowledge of data structures implementation and optimization
Expert level skills in multi-threading, concurrency, and error-handling
Expert level skills in implementing design patterns (singleton, facade, factory, observer etc.)
Experience building enterprise scale web services (RESTful), and their scalability, resiliency, and availability
Experience building application frameworks or reusable components
Experience in network programming (Sockets) to build service self-healing
Experience implementing multiple cross cutting concerns and non-functional requirements using aspect oriented programming (viz. aspectJ)
Demonstrated proficiency in troubleshooting, root-cause analysis, application design, and implementing large components for enterprise projects

Desired qualifications
Experience in Building highly robust Android or iOS applications
Experience in building ODATA compliant REST services
Experience in language features such as lambda expressions, generics, and streams
Experience in working on cryptography and Bluetooth based transmission protocols
Experience in IoT, NFC, machine learning / data science, NLP
Experience in payments tech industry
Additional Information

Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

5cf64cf878c6f75e.title: Product Manager, Desktop & Web
5cf64cf878c6f75e.description:
We are looking for a Product Manager to join our world-class R&D organization. In this role, you will be primarily responsible for working closely with our engineering team to help shape and communicate our roadmap. Your efforts will be focused on our support for desktop, web, and emerging streaming platforms. This will include helping to develop our long term strategy, keeping a pulse on what Unity developers need, and keeping an eye on the competitive landscape. You will be working with our platform partners to help make their ecosystems a place where Unity developers can thrive.

Unity is dedicated to helping our users get the most out of each platform they choose to ship on and be successful. Come join us and help empower millions of our users to do just that.

Responsibilities


Work with team leads to define roadmaps for desktop, web, and cloud-based platforms
Listen to developers needs and translate them into feature requirements that empower our users to get the most out of each platform
Working with leading platform vendors to help improve their ecosystems to help Unity's developer community succeed
Be an authority on the market and competitive landscape and keep internal teams informed on relevant changes
Work with marketing teams to plan and execute go to market plans for new features and products
Represent the product as a spokesperson and knowledgeable authority with users, suppliers, press, and strategic partners

Requirements


Producer or Product Management experience in a leading gaming or platform development business
Successfully developed and guided new product feature delivery, including a proven ability to champion product enhancements through to successful launch
Experience in releasing software on desktop, web, or streaming platforms
A solid understanding of modern techniques used to develop software at scale
Excellent product management, communication, and leadership skills
A collaborator that works well in team environments
Have the ability to build a business case around a product or service

Bonus Points


Experience in software development using C++, C# or another major language
Experience as a game developer or producer
Experience building developer tools or platforms

Who we are

Unity is the creator of the world's most widely-used real-time 3D (RT3D) development platform, providing content creators around the world with the tools they need to build rich, interactive 2D, 3D, VR and AR experiences. In fact, apps made with Unity reach 2.7 billion devices worldwide, and were installed more than 24 billion times in the last 12 months.

The global engineering team keeps Unity at the forefront of technology and — working alongside partners like Magic Leap, Google, Facebook, Oculus and Microsoft — ensures optimized support for the latest technology and platforms. Unity is powering the real-time revolution, expanding beyond games and breaking into other industries including automotive, film, architecture, engineering, construction and more.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

#LI-JC1

6a720e0f4272731a.title: AI Engineering - Senior Machine Learning Engineer
6a720e0f4272731a.description:
AI Engineering - Senior Machine Learning Engineer

JPMorgan Chase (JPMC) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2 trillion and operations in more than 60 countries. It is on the transformation journey to be a client-centric technology driven company over the last few years. With an annual tech budget of $10B+, it has started significantly investing and building in the next generation core infrastructure, data and AI technology.

As the next push into this investment, JPMC Silicon Valley is hiring the best talents to join the newly-formed AI engineering team. We are executing like a startup and building the next generation technology that combines JPMC unique data and full service advantage to develop high impact AI applications and platforms in the financial services industry. We are looking for people who are excited about the opportunity.

Responsibilities
Research and implement deep learning, machine learning and statistical approaches to solve business problems.
Collaborate with all of JPMorgan’s lines of business. Focus on delivering results, prioritizing needs while dealing with ambiguity
Build V1 of model and present results to data scientist and non-technical business users.
Partner with developer, engineering teams to create production training pipeline and inference workflows.
Lead a team of engineers and virtual teams. Provide thought leadership.
Minimum Qualifications
BS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science or related quantitative field.
Fluency in programming skills e.g. Python, R, C/C++, Java, Python or other equivalent languages.
Expert in Deep learning architectures e.g. CNN, RNN, LSTM etc. Expert in at least one of the following areas: Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Speech Recognition, Reinforcement Learning, Ranking and Recommendation, or Time Series Analysis.
Expertise in one major machine learning frameworks: Tensorflow, Caffe/Caffe2, Pytorch, Keras, MXNet, Scikit-Learn.
Demonstrate experience of making trade-offs between schedule, resources, model performance etc
Experience in ETL pipelines, both batch and real-time data processing.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Self-motivation, great communication skills and team player.
Thought Leader who can conceptualize big vision and define plan for Machine Learning, metrics and deliverables.

Preferred Qualifications
Cloud computing: Google Cloud, Amazon Web Service, Azure, Docker, Kubernetes.
Experience in big data technologies: Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Kafka.
Experience in distributed system design and development


When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.

At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

0520cccfbdf08151.description:
Computer Courage is a digital agency looking to hire a second Project Manager for our Web Services team. We’re looking for someone who is a great communicator, able to organize project tasks and timelines, is comfortable with technology, and has a passion for helping businesses succeed.

Responsibilities

Manage, assign, and review tasks in our project management system

Work with Designers and Developers to keep projects aligned with goals
Provide basic quality control and feedback on websites in development
Keep projects and tasks on schedule and within scope
Keep customers happy and set expectations

Availability to work full time in our Emeryville, CA office

Ability to multitask and work in a fast paced environment

99fcd7352be76aeb.title: Technical Support Manager
99fcd7352be76aeb.description:
Plaid’s products are being used to enable thousands of developers to build the next generation of financial-services applications. When those developers have problems, they turn to the Plaid Support team. Our goal is to help our customers, as quickly and compassionately as possible, to keep their applications running and their end-users happy.

The Technical Support Manager leads a team of Technical Support Engineers (TSEs), guiding their development and supporting them in their day-to-day work. The manager’s primary responsibilities are to help TSEs grow in their career and to ensure they and our customers are getting what they need to be successful.

Technical Support Managers work alongside their teams, interacting directly with customers, as well as with Engineering, Product, Design, Growth, and Sales to support and improve Plaid’s products and services. Success in this role is reflected in the success of the Support team–high quality products, satisfied customers, and satisfied team members.
What excites you
Meeting one-on-one with Support team members
Planning and fostering Support career growth
Providing regular, actionable feedback to Support team members
Maintaining open communication channels within the Support team
Serving as the voice of the customer and working with cross-functional partners to improve our products
What excites us
Servant-leadership mindset
Customer-first attitude with a strong sense of empathy
Familiarity with modern web services and APIs
Analytical and data-oriented approach to problem solving
Experience in people management
Impeccable written communication skills
Extra points for
Experience leading a technical support team
Software development experience and/or ability
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

20b2ef6ac09e78f2.title: Product Engineer
20b2ef6ac09e78f2.description:
ClearDATA is seeking creative and passionate product engineering experts to join us in making healthcare better every single day. Our customers include some of the biggest names in healthcare and life sciences. They depend on us to deliver tools, systems, and services that keep them compliant and secure in the cloud without slowing them down. Developers at ClearDATA have the opportunity to have a real impact on this mission every single day.

What You’ll Do:
Building solutions leveraging modern cloud-based technology to solve problems facing healthcare/life sciences organizations
Delivering an amazing customer experience
Designing solutions for scale, resiliency, maintainability, and compliance
Design and build automation to enable increased operational efficiency within organizations managing cloud-based technology
Work with a passionate team delivering solutions to some of the premier brands in the healthcare space
What You’ll Need:
At least 3 years in a systems engineering or software engineering role
Hands-on career experience with Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud Platform
Experience implementing full lifecycle development (design, test, implement, document, deploy)
Advanced experience with Python, Node.js, or Golang
A passion for lifelong learning

What Will Make You Stand Out:
Customer empathy
Advanced Amazon, Microsoft, or Google cloud certifications
Hands on experience with multiple public cloud platforms
Background in healthcare or life sciences
Experience working in and around regulated environments and patient data
Track-record of learning and career growth
Experience working with geographically distributed teams
Practical experience building and scaling microservices
Experience working in teams leveraging modern CI and CD concepts & tools
Why You’ll Like Working Here:
A dynamic company that rewards high-performers
Be on the cutting edge of new technologies and services
Collaborative team environment that values multiple perspectives and fresh thinking
Servant leadership Management
Business-casual dress code
Flexible working hours
Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA, Life and 401K
Stock options
Unlimited Vacation
Competitive base, commission and bonus structure

Job Description

We are developing and executing a shared strategic vision for Marketing platforms and products that enable Visa to be the world-leading data-driven payments company. As a Software developer, you will work closely with a world-class team of Development and Test Engineers.

9ec70ca1cf70ec98.title: Head of Product/Technology
9ec70ca1cf70ec98.description:
Are you looking for a position where you can help affect meaningful change?

Mindful Schools, a non-profit organization, and a leader in the Mindfulness in Education movement, is seeking an innovative, meticulous product and technology lead who is motivated and fulfilled by the fact that their work directly makes possible the fulfillment of our mission to train the world’s educators in mindfulness and teaching mindfulness to children in ways that transform school communities from the inside out.

We are a passionate, collaborative, eclectic team with a culture that values work-life balance and provides employees with generous benefits.

Join us, and put your skills to work in service of creating a world where every young person has access to the gift of mindfulness.


Position Overview:

The Head of Product/Technology will be a tech savvy leader who can oversee the long-term vision and strategy for Mindful Schools’ learning and community products as well as manage the tech team to deliver on the operational and marketing-related tech needs of the organization.

The ideal candidate is a self-starter energized by challenge and thrives in an ever changing environment of constant growth-someone who can develop a deep understanding of the customer experience in order to identify and fill product gaps, oversee technology and platform solutions, and generate new ideas to grow impact. Strong process and project management skills will be essential to this role’s success.

The Head of Product/Technology works closely with and manages the IT Manager, and Website and Salesforce Developer and reports to the Director of Operations.

This is a full-time, on-site position in our sunny, casual Emeryville, CA office.


Essential Functions

Gather inputs from new technologies, market forces, competitive organizations, customer insights, and product development best practices to design Mindful Schools’ learning and community products, features, and user experiences

Own the vision for systems and process integration across our hardware, firmware, and software, including the backend architecture to support new product features

Communicate product strategy to product stakeholders and create buy-in for the product vision both internally and with key external partners

Lead the technology department to deliver world-class technical products and solutions for our internal and external customers

Required Education, Experience, and Skills
4+ years of experience in a Product Management role in which you have shipped multiple releases that have scaled, ideally for an education audience

Proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle

Proven ability to develop product strategy and effectively communicate recommendations to executive management

Solid technical background with understanding and hands-on experience in software development and web technologies

Strong problem solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done

Skilled at working effectively with cross functional teams in a matrix organization

Knowledge of Learning and Community Platform Technologies

Excellent verbal and written communication skills



Preferred Education, Experience, and Skills

MS/BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other relevant subject matter

Working knowledge of Salesforce.com platform; Salesforce certifications are a plus

Experience in the education sector (working for a school, college, or university in a technology capacity)-a strong preference for experience in online learner success, which includes recruiting, admissions, onboarding, community interaction, and the full online education experience

Additional Eligibility Qualifications

Must be eligible to work in the United States


Salary & Benefits:
This is a full-time position. We offer a competitive salary and a generous benefits package that reflects our values, including:

100% employer-paid medical, dental, vision, and life insurance

Flexible spending accounts (FSAs)

403(b) retirement plan with up to a 4% employer match

Generous PTO

And more!


To Apply:

To apply please submit the following:
A cover letter expressing why this position appeals to you and how your skills and experience match our needs

Your résumé

f1aa8695dc3c4f83.title: Apigee Consultant
f1aa8695dc3c4f83.description:
The team
Cloud Engineering
Our Cloud Engineering team focuses on enabling our client’s end-to-end journey from On-Premise to Cloud, with opportunities in the areas of: Cloud Strategy, Op Model Transformation, Cloud Development, Cloud Integration & APIs, Cloud Migration, Cloud Infrastructure & Engineering, and Cloud Managed Services. We help our clients see the transformational capabilities of Cloud as an opportunity for business enablement and competitive advantage.
Cloud Engineering supports our clients as they improve agility and resilience, and identifies opportunities to reduce IT operations spend through automation by enabling Cloud. We accelerate our clients towards a technology-driven future, leveraging vendor solutions and Deloitte-developed software products, tools, and accelerators.
Work you’ll do
Install, configure, and test Apigee installations and Upgrades
Design, develop, configure, and troubleshoot APIs and policies using APIGEE
Implement requirements of the API layer like security, custom analytics, throttling, caching, logging, monetization, request and response modifications etc. using Apigee
Design and develop API platform to connect to various disparate backend systems for seamless data exchange
Build and support the APIs through the entire lifecycle
Perform regular health checks and monitor performance of the Apigee environment
Write Open API spec and smart docs for on boarding APIs to developer portal
Convert web services from SOAP to REST or vice-versa, using Apigee API management platform
Create custom policies in Java, JavaScript, Node js, Python etc in Apigee or any other APIM
Build and create shared flows for Error Handling, Security and other scenarios
Work with the product vendor on issue resolution and enhancements
Debug Apigee EDGE components
Write Automation Test cases


Qualifications
Required:
Knowledge and experience in developing software using agile methodologies
Ability to communicate effectively via multiple channels (verbal, written, etc.) with technical and non-technical staff
Strong knowledge of Apigee component architecture and implementation configurations
Experience with design and development of REST API platform using APIGEE/APIM, converting web services from SOAP to REST or vice-versa
Experience in API layer like security, custom analytics, throttling, caching, logging, monetization, request and response modifications etc. using APIGEE
Experience with APIGEE edge and API management
Experience with High availability, load balancing and failover configurations with Apigee
Knowledge of JavaScript for writing APIGEE mashup APIs
Knowledge of health checks and monitoring procedures for Apigee components & APIs
Understanding of TLS, certificates, keystore and truststore
API Analytics - generation of custom reports and integration with external tools like Splunk
Experience with API security norms and conversant in common Internet technologies and protocols viz HTTPs, SSL, OAuth, REST, JSON, XML etc
Travel up to 80-100%
Preferred:
Apigee Trained
Apigee Certified (API Engineer Certification)
Experience in Drupal portal with ability to extend functionality using Drupal modules
How you’ll grow
At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center.
Benefits
At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.
Deloitte’s culture
Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.
Corporate citizenship
Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.
Recruiter tips
We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.

b0355acbd6d6549c.title: Sr. Backend Engineer, Insights & Reporting
b0355acbd6d6549c.description:
Our mission is to build the world's fastest, most secure, scaleable, and highly available content platform. Serving a rich contextual metadata platform alongside billions of files, hundreds of millions of folders, and tens of millions of users, the Box Content Platform is the very heart of our product and foundation of our platform.

Box is rapidly evolving across many fronts - from simplifying and enhancing sharing, to implementing new ways to annotate, search, filter, and organize content, to enabling powerful new platform use-cases that stretch us to the limits of our scale. We are a small dedicated team, passionate about building a robust, distributed, scalable platform powering content and collaboration at Box. If this sounds like an exciting challenge to you, come join us.

Enterprise Org
We build products related to analytics, security, data lifecycle management, quality, and future architecture . Teams within the group include:

Enterprise Governance: full stack team building legal and compliance products: retention, legal holds, classification, etc.
Enterprise Workflow: full stack team building automated workflow products to get work done and build mission-critical business processes within Box
Enterprise Experience: full stack team building enterprise management as well as Admin Console user experience
Enterprise Users & Groups: full stack team building enterprise users, groups life cycle management and their roles, permissions, etc.
Enterprise Insights & Reporting: full stack team building the near real-time customer-facing analytics and reporting

Role and Team
As a Senior Backend Engineer on Enterprise Insights, you'll be leading the effort in building our customer-facing analytics dashboards a s well as our report ing products . To see recent features, check out our dashboard guide here: https://community.box.com/t5/How-to-Guides-for-Admins/Using-Insights-in-the-Admin-Dashboard/ta-p/236

We plan to focus on analytics highlighting:
Collaboration - within the organization and externally
Usage - current usage and future trends
Security - normal behavior and abnormal behavior

Why Box needs you
Box needs technical leader s who inspire others and can work across organizational and team boundaries to drive decisions that align the future architecture, product, and business goals. In this role, y ou will lead significant technology initiatives from inception to successful deployment spanning multiple layers of architecture. We wi ll look to you to provide your perspective on industry trends, recommendations on new and emerging technologies, and thought leadership on improving product quality and engineering process es . You will innovate alongside other senior members of our staff as we build Box to help our customers .

Wh y you need Box
The Box engineering team provides a unique combination of technical challenges around scale and robustness . As part of Enterprise Engineering you will have the opportunity to drive the product and technical vision as well as deliver critical features used by 70% of Fortune 500 companies . With Insights & Reporting, you will be design ing and releas ing new services that allow you go the full breadth of Box from presenting analytics data in web applications to i ntegrat ing with systems for streaming computations in the cloud .

What you'll be responsible for

Making key contributions to the technical roadmap of the E nterprise Engineering organization
Drive the design and implementation of features related to Insights and Reporting products
Influence the team's processes and execution methods
Coach and mentor other engineers and teams
Collaborate with other senior engineers across our organization to shape Box's overall technical strategy

Who you are

Several years of experience as a software engineer
Pragmatic experience decomposing monolithic applications into service-oriented architectures
Fluent in any modern object-oriented or functional programming languages such as Java, Scala, PHP, Javascript, Node.js
Pride in being an owner in both your engineering work and in your team interactions

E xperience s welcomed

E xperience executing projects involving distributed systems
Technical lead in the past for a team of at least 3+ engineers
Able to influence other teams to align with your technical and product vision
Played with the Box APIs or have developed your own APIs

Learn more:
See "Security: Access Controls and Visibility" and "Security: Governance and Compliance" spaces in the Box Overviewhttps:// www.box.com/products-and-features
Governance & compliance: https://www.box.com/security/governance-and-compliance
IT & Admin Controls: https://www.box.com/security/it-admin-controls
Box Community - Governance: https://community.box.com/t5/Box-Governance-Resource-Center/ct-p/BoxGovernance
Box Community - Admin Resources: https://community.box.com/t5/New-Admin-Resource-Center/ct-p/NewAdmin
Legal Holds Launch Post: https://blog.box.com/blog/legal-holds-now-available-box-governance-customers/
Box Tasks and Automations BoxWorks18 announcement: https://youtu.be/snGRvi2bDjA
Box Tasks and Automations BoxWorks18 demo: https://youtu.be/Qf1rVZ8BLcg
Streamlining collaborative work with Box Tasks and Automations: https://blog.box.com/blog/boxworks-2018-intelligence-automation-digital-business
Tech Blog: https://blog.box.com/blog/category/engineering
Open Source Projects: http://opensource.box.com/
Developer Platform: https://developer.box.com/

About Box

Founded in 2005, Box (NYSE: BOX) is transforming the way people and organizations work so they can achieve their greatest ambitions. As the world's leading enterprise software platform for secure content collaboration, Box helps business of all sizes in every industry securely access and manage their critical information in the cloud. Box is headquartered in Redwood City, CA, with offices across the United States, Europe and Asia.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
