0cd64bf52b0af6b2.title: SWAT Manager
0cd64bf52b0af6b2.description:
Title: SWAT Manager
Location: Santa Clara, CA or San Francisco, CA

Company is seeking an experienced Database/DevOps/SWAT Manager to join our SWAT team within the company. You should have experience with large scale MySQL environments and a knack for problem solving and optimization databases, application and performance issues. Qualified candidates will be responsible to lead a team of highly skilled engineers that push the limits of scalability through our specialized single-shard technology. As part of this role you will be responsible to learn the application, troubleshoot any peroformance issues resulting in from databases or application (JVM) and provide feedback to developers on best practices.
What you'll be doing:
Lead and facilitate technical discussions to strategize scaling out MySQL.
Manage and grow future leaders in the team
Build a team of engineers that would engineer solutions and automate daily operational tasks
Assist the team with technical problems and incidents when necessary
Learn basic aspects of the application and become SME’s in 2-3 areas for the application.
Work with the team to maintain weekend on-call rotation only for your timezone.
Work with developers on best practices and provide insight how we benefit from them in the application.
Your background and who you are:
Must have Bachelor’s Degree in Information Science, Computer Science or similar areas or equivalent work experience
Must have 2+ years of experience managing teams of engineers and/or Database Administrators
Must have 5+ years of MySQL and Linux experience in an intensive, high-traffic, web-based, multi-threading applications on multi-core architecture environment
Must have expert level knowledge in MySQL 5.6+, complete understanding of different engines and related utilities such as Percona Toolkit, mysqladmin etc.
Must have experience in backup/recovery/failover methods and best practices
Must have experience in scripting languages, such as PHP, Shell, Perl, Python, etc.
Must have background in performance.
Knowledge of JVM is a huge plus

55426e0907d7fca2.title: Senior Mobile Engineer, iOS
55426e0907d7fca2.description:
Varo is on a mission to redefine banking so it's easy for everyone to make smart choices with their money. Our app offers bank accounts and high-yield savings accounts that don’t cost a thing, tools to help you manage your money and save automatically, and invitation-only personal loans at competitive rates. On the contrary, traditional banks charge fees, offer next-to-nothing savings rates, and don’t work with their customer’s best interests in mind.

Varo is distinct from other fintechs: With preliminary approval for a bank charter from the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC), we're on our way to becoming the first mobile-centric national bank in the country. Our unique team combines the best people in tech and banking, and we’re wildly passionate about keeping our customers happy by helping them manage and grow their money. Based in San Francisco and privately held, Varo has raised $144M to date, led by Warburg Pincus and The Rise Fund / TPG Growth.

ABOUT THIS ROLE

We are looking for a highly driven, consumer oriented iOS developer to join our growing Engineering team. This role is responsible for the development and maintenance of applications aimed at a range of iOS devices including mobile phones and tablets. Your primary focus will be development of iOS applications and their integration with back-end services. You will be working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and the creation of quality products is essential.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Build iOS applications and the integration with full range of bank-end services.
Work with storyboards and in code, using manual or auto layout, to build custom views and custom animations
Build beautiful, exact UIs that meet the highest standard of fit and finish
Build applications that reflect a passion for quality.
PAST EXPERIENCES THAT'LL HELP YOU BE GREAT
5+ years experience in iOS native applications development.
Solid understanding of mobile application architecture, including traditional Cocoa MVC patterns.
Strong skills in Swift, Realm, push notifications.
Strong knowledge of UIKit and CoreAnimation. Able to work with storyboards and in code, using manual or auto layout, to build custom views and custom animations.
Experience in using Quick and Nimble to test the work.
Understanding of Android applications.
Good understanding of REST and experience in integrating mobile applications with REST APIs.
Basic understanding of Java, AWS, and Linux to help troubleshoot issues during integration testing between UI and backend.
Understanding of Scrum development process.
Experience using Jira, Confluence, and Git.
Experience in building mobile web applications is a plus.
Financial industry experience is a plus.

THE THREE SKILLS THAT MATTER MOST
Nobody can be great at everything, but we're looking for candidates who are extraordinary at:
Understanding the need of our customers and thus making our product better
Being passionate and taking pride in what you and your team produces
Sharing your knowledge with your peers, through code reviews and mentoring

OTHER NICE TO HAVES
Financial industry experience

3676a65362773523.title: Senior Security Engineer - Infrastructure
3676a65362773523.description:
About Us

At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world's largest networks that powers more than 10 trillion requests per month. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare have all web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was recognized by the World Economic Forum as a Technology Pioneer and named to Entrepreneur Magazine's Top Company Cultures list.

We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!

About the Department

The Security team at Cloudflare is focused and committed to helping secure both Cloudflare and our customers. The Infrastructure Security team works closely with the engineering teams responsible for running and maintaining our global infrastructure. Our mission is to help build security into the hardware and software that run Cloudflare's products.

What you'll do

We are looking for an experienced Security Engineer to help us in our mission to build a better internet. Part engineer, part hacker, you will work with our engineering and infrastructure teams to help secure our globally distributed systems.


Work to ensure our global infrastructure is secure from all attacks, ranging from "script kiddies" to nation states.
Mentor junior members of the team.
Build internal security tools that help fix security problems at a massive scale.
Be a technical lead, driving products from inception to completion with other members of the security team, as well as engineering teams across the company.

Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience


Experience on a security engineering team, ideally as a technical lead.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to distill complex security issues into concise explanations.
Experience in engineering creative solutions in response to ever changing attack methodologies.
Experience in developing and debugging in at least one programming language, with a preference towards Go, C/C++, or Rust.
Knowledge of cryptographic primitives and how they can be safely used.
Familiar with the challenges of processing security events at scale.
Expertise in securing hardware. You should be able to talk about the differences between secure boot, trusted boot and verified boot. You should know when to use a TPM or HSM.

What Makes Us Special

We're not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We're a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.

Project Galileo ( https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/ ): We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare's enterprise customers--at no cost.

Project Athenian ( https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/ ): We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.

Path Forward Partnership ( https://blog.cloudflare.com/tag/path-forward/ ): Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.

1.1.1.1 ( https://1.1.1.1/ ): We released 1.1.1.1 ( https://1.1.1.1/ ) to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here's the deal - we don't store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy policy ( https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/commitment-to-privacy/privacy-policy/privacy-policy/ ) and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.

Sound like something you'd like to be a part of? We'd love to hear from you!

Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.

Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.

9b4c957aab9c29f3.title: (Senior) Product Manager
9b4c957aab9c29f3.description:
About Us:
Stellar is redefining the world of private aviation, a $30B+ industry in dire need of new, cutting-edge technology, full of fleet operators striving for a better way to run their businesses and highly-discerning customers looking for a better travel experience. Our people are what will make this exciting transformation possible by developing innovative technology and facilitating its use. Stellar alone has the unique potential to dominate the industry and, in the process, more than double its current size.

(Senior) Product Manager:
Every day, the private aviation industry has 15,000+ open requests to either charter flights or list their own fleet for availability. It’s a thriving ecosystem of brokers, flight departments and jet owners. As product manager, you’ll build the platform that brings together all these players.

You will help build the next generation private aviation scheduling platform. As product manager, you will partner in the product strategy, roadmap and the customer backlog of features required to support a operator’s end to end scheduling and trip management workflows. These features include managing trip itineraries, assigning passengers and crew members, managing trip services, and flight logging and expenses.

Responsibilities:

Work alongside the business development team to form partnerships with fleet operators, and develop go-to-market strategies
Own vision, roadmapping, spec-writing, feature prioritization, project management
Manage product backlog of our scheduling platform and serve as PO to shepard the user stories into an award winning solution; exceeding customer expectations.
Wireframe UI/UX and work with designers and front end devs to develop user workflows
Involvement in mobile and desktop app features
Define and track key metrics and communicate learnings to the rest of the team
Reports to the VP of Product Management

What We're Looking For:

You’re a natural leader and lift the performance of cross-functional team
Building a next generation scheduling platform excites you
You are data-informed but have deep empathy for the user and sharp product instincts
Passion for great design, know what works and what doesn’t
Technical enough to communicate effectively with developers
Rigorous; you ask lots of hard questions
You know where process is helpful but can also recognize where a little chaos is helpful
You’re comfortable and effective working with distributed teams
You are humble and have a sense of humor

Requirements:

3+ years of product management experience (senior title for individuals with extended experience)
Knowledgeable with both front end web and mobile technologies and back end technology stacks
Experience building product from a user-centered design approach, used lean experiments to in/validate your hypotheses, and coordinated teams in an XP/Agile environment.
Bonus Points: You’re an aviation geek, you may even have your pilots license!
Ability to commute and work in our Burlingame location

Perks:

Flexible vacation policy
Competitive salary & equity based on experience
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision coverage
Paid Parental Leave
401(k)
FSA
Commuter benefits
Life and AD&D insurance
EAP
Catered Lunches
Paid parking (or commute credit) at our downtown Burlingame office location (walk to Caltrain)
Company Social Events
Get in on the ground floor of a highly-collaborative, rapidly growing start-up disrupting the aviation industry
Note: Perks are subject to change in company's discretion

9f3120d1677d15cf.title: Salesforce Business Systems Analyst
9f3120d1677d15cf.description:
Salesforce Business Systems Analyst
University of San Francisco

R0001438
USF Hilltop Campus

Job Title:
Salesforce Business Systems Analyst

Job Summary:
The University of San Francisco seeks an energetic and organized individual with outstanding verbal and written communications skills to join the staff of its Information Technology Services (ITS) - Application Services group as a Salesforce Business Systems Analyst. This position requires a high degree of self-motivation and excellent analytical skills.

Full Job Description:
Responsibilities and duties:
Serve as system administrator for the Salesforce.com environment with 275+ users.
Handle all basic administrative functions including user account maintenance, maintenance reports, workflows and other routine tasks.
Evaluate requests for new or changed functionality to determine requirements and draft documentation.
Schedule and organize student focus groups, report on the outcomes and prioritize the story backlog accordingly.
Translate high level requirements into user stories for the development team; ensuring stories and features are added iteratively to the product to add overall value.
Work closely with business users and functional experts to develop technical specifications for new features.
Be the primary point of contact for all quality assurance issues regarding Salesforce Sales Cloud and Community Cloud apps.
Report defects to and request enhancements from our Salesforce Managed Services provider.
Configure the app and work with our vendors and developers to prepare releases to production.
Process, review and interpret large bodies of qualitative and quantitative data on customer usage patterns to uncover new product insights.
Conduct situational and data analysis to identify, understand, and ensure features are aligned with product objectives and delivering the most value to the business.
Provide kickoff-to-release project management for small enhancements and integrations with other University systems.
Manage a story backlog to ensure readiness of user stories for the upcoming sprint.
Facilitate efficient communication between all project stakeholders, including product, development, the Office of Marketing and Communications (OMC), and all users of Salesforce.
Create acceptance criteria that are clear, concise and actionable.
Schedule, organize, task, and report on project progress.
Contribute to creating and maintaining the application roadmap.
Conduct business process analyses with business users and document existing and new functionality to support the business processes.
Analyze existing operational procedures - identifying opportunities for new efficiencies and improved user training.
Facilitate the design and specification of new work flow processes.
Develop use cases and test plans for new features, and system upgrades.
Develop communication plans related to the launch of new app features.
Support business users in developing report specifications and effectively translating them into business intelligence reports and dashboards.
Keep up to date with industry trends and solutions in Higher Education.
Monitor defect reports and work closely with the team to triage issues.
Perform other relevant duties as assigned.

About You:
Foremost, you have to care about students and making a difference in their lives. You are passionate, empathetic, and care that your work serves a greater purpose than just profit. You want to make a mark on the world and help push our society to change and grow for the better.
Change Influencer - Acts as an agent of change within your team, organization, and leading to embrace new methodologies, processes, efficiencies and challenging the status quo. Constantly pushing and asking why even if it's to Senior Executives. You must be a strong communicator and partner, capable of influencing a team

Required qualifications and skills:
Salesforce Administrator certification (ADM-201C) required.
Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, handle and prioritize simultaneous requests, and manage laterally and upwards.
Creative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills.
Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization.
Ability to critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Ability to assess the impact of new requirements on Salesforce.com and all upstream and downstream applications, systems, and processes.
Requires a bachelor's degree (preferably in Computer Science) and 4+ years of professional experience in software development and application administration.
4+ years work experience configuring the Salesforce.com platform.
Experience with Workflow Rules, Validation Rules, Assignment Rules.
Demonstrated ability to take business requirements and use to formulate Solution Design.
Demonstrable proficiency with Salesforce Development Tools.
Completion of several Salesforce integration, extension and development projects.
Good understanding of application architecture principles, protocols and practices, including data structures, data modeling, and data security.
Experience debugging and resolving issues with existing code.
Experience integrating Salesforce with 3rd party system using web services and integration engines.
In-depth understanding of Salesforce technologies (clouds, offerings, custom development, integration).
Ability to work off-hours to resolve application issues or problems.
Observe confidentiality of work-related information and materials.
Strong multi-tasking and prioritization skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Additional Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Experience working with Salesforce AppExchange applications.
Experience with Agile development methodology/Scrum is preferred.
Experience with Data Integration Tools such as Informatica Cloud.
Solid understanding of SaaS architecture concepts and design patterns.
Solid understanding of Salesforce.com development best practices and design patterns.
Experience using troubleshooting techniques to resolve application related problems.
Strong data management abilities.
A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion.
A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements.
Experience with Higher Education processes preferred.
Previous experience working in a SCRUM or agile environment preferred.

Full-Time/Part-Time:
Full time

Pay Rate:
Salary

To apply, visit https://usfca.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/USF_Staff/job/USF-Hilltop-Campus/Salesforce-Business-Systems-Analyst_R0001438.

The University of San Francisco is located in the heart of one of the world’s most innovative and diverse cities, and is home to a vibrant academic community of students and faculty who achieve excellence in their fields. Its diverse student body enjoys direct access to faculty, small classes and outstanding opportunities in the city itself. USF is San Francisco's first university, and its Jesuit Catholic mission helps ignite a student’s passion for social justice and a desire to “Change the World From Here.” For more information, visit http://www.usfca.edu.

6f775b6c0d750a83.title: Senior Software Engineer, UI Automation (REF16052Z) - Visa Digital Developer Platform (VDDP)
6f775b6c0d750a83.description:
Job Description

Our UI Engineering team is focusing on building a Component-Based WebUI with modern Javascript frameworks that are building blocks for key applications used by millions of users, as a part of Visa Digital Commerce Platform suite of SDKs and applications including Visa Checkout. Our group is creating Javascript based SDK and ReactJS based Web applications to implement modern front-end architecture that relies on key technologies such as CSS Modules, Semantic HTML, and Isomorphism with server-side rendering. The team is focused on using right technologies and methods that deliver the best possible experience to the end user.
This position is based in Foster City, CA and will report to the Director of Product Development.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Be accountable and responsible for the quality behind successful introduction of newly deployed products and feature sets to the market.
Develop test strategy and test cases, review them with cross functional team and improve the test scenarios
Drive towards 100% automation of all test cases to meet functional, non-functional and security standards
Automate integration with several backend systems
Continuously maintain Automation Test Suites and ensure that the suite is robust enough to be reconfigured for execution on multiple environments
Follow development best practices including test driven development, pair programming, peer code reviews, etc.
Use a variety of tools to perform unit testing, regression testing, automated builds
Develop healthy working relationships and collaborate with members of cross functional teams within the organization.

Qualifications

Basic
B.S/M.S in Computer Science or related field
Preferred
3 to 5 years of professional, relevant work experience
Our UI components are used by several thousand merchants and millions of customers worldwide. Qualified candidate should have a quality first mindset, understanding clean code and clean architecture best practices and have a proven track record of developing high quality, bug-free code
 Excellent conceptual understanding of DOM, JavaScript, HTML/CSS and cross browser rendering, behavior and performance. The candidate should have high level knowledge on user experience, asset loading, browser rendering, responsive design, state management, Javascript asynchronous patterns
Have proven experience in understanding the system and grasping the major flows from end user perspective
Experience in or familiarity with modern JavaScript frameworks (e.g. React/Redux, Angular, etc.)
Strong understanding of semantic HTML web markup & CSS
Strong understanding of modern JavaScript design patterns - preferably flux based
Hands on Skills Designing and Developing Automation Test Suites using Selenium/TEST NG Framework for Functional,, Integration and Regression Test Coverage.
Experience implementing static typing in JavaScript (Babel, Typescript)
Familiar with TDD practices. Comfortable with Jest, Jasmine, Cypress, Webdriver.io, and other automation frameworks to develop and keep the test suite up to date.
Experience with asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and REST APIs with AJAX
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as GIT.
Have a collaborative mindset and put the team goals first
Familiarity with Java and Apache Tomcat is a plus
Additional Information

Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

8b0e8853930d8376.title: Apigee Senior Consultant
8b0e8853930d8376.description:
The team
Cloud Engineering
Our Cloud Engineering team focuses on enabling our client’s end-to-end journey from On-Premise to Cloud, with opportunities in the areas of: Cloud Strategy, Op Model Transformation, Cloud Development, Cloud Integration & APIs, Cloud Migration, Cloud Infrastructure & Engineering, and Cloud Managed Services. We help our clients see the transformational capabilities of Cloud as an opportunity for business enablement and competitive advantage.
Cloud Engineering supports our clients as they improve agility and resilience, and identifies opportunities to reduce IT operations spend through automation by enabling Cloud. We accelerate our clients towards a technology-driven future, leveraging vendor solutions and Deloitte-developed software products, tools, and accelerators.
Work you’ll do
Install, configure, and test Apigee installations and Upgrades
Design, develop, configure, and troubleshoot APIs and policies using APIGEE
Implement requirements of the API layer like security, custom analytics, throttling, caching, logging, monetization, request and response modifications etc. using Apigee
Design and develop API platform to connect to various disparate backend systems for seamless data exchange
Build and support the APIs through the entire lifecycle
Perform regular health checks and monitor performance of the Apigee environment
Write Open API spec and smart docs for on boarding APIs to developer portal
Convert web services from SOAP to REST or vice-versa, using Apigee API management platform
Create custom policies in Java, JavaScript, Node js, Python etc in Apigee or any other APIM
Build and create shared flows for Error Handling, Security and other scenarios
Work with the product vendor on issue resolution and enhancements
Debug Apigee EDGE components
Write Automation Test cases


Qualifications
Required:
Knowledge and experience in developing software using agile methodologies
Ability to communicate effectively via multiple channels (verbal, written, etc.) with technical and non-technical staff
Strong knowledge of Apigee component architecture and implementation configurations
Experience with design and development of REST API platform using APIGEE/APIM, converting web services from SOAP to REST or vice-versa
Experience in API layer like security, custom analytics, throttling, caching, logging, monetization, request and response modifications etc. using APIGEE
Experience with APIGEE edge and API management
Experience with High availability, load balancing and failover configurations with Apigee
Knowledge of JavaScript for writing APIGEE mashup APIs
Knowledge of health checks and monitoring procedures for Apigee components & APIs
Understanding of TLS, certificates, keystore and truststore
API Analytics - generation of custom reports and integration with external tools like Splunk
Experience with API security norms and conversant in common Internet technologies and protocols viz HTTPs, SSL, OAuth, REST, JSON, XML etc
Travel up to 80-100%
Preferred:
Apigee Trained
Apigee Certified (API Engineer Certification)
Experience in Drupal portal with ability to extend functionality using Drupal modules
How you’ll grow
At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center.
Benefits
At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.
Deloitte’s culture
Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.
Corporate citizenship
Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.
Recruiter tips
We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.

3dfe8cc2f1662ba6.title: RFP & Deal Support Manager
3dfe8cc2f1662ba6.description:
About Us

At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world's largest networks that powers more than 10 trillion requests per month. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare have all web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was recognized by the World Economic Forum as a Technology Pioneer and named to Entrepreneur Magazine's Top Company Cultures list.

We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!

About the Department

Sales Operations, Account Executives, Channel Account Managers, Business Development Representatives, Solution Engineers and Customer Success - all working together help our customers adopt Cloudflare and create great Internet-enabled experiences. The sales team at Cloudflare helps customers solve real, technical problems while creating the revenue streams that help the company provide free service to millions in our community.

What you'll do

We're looking for an experienced RFP and Deal Support Manager who is excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced environment to support a growing global Sales Team. The role will help to ensure that all RFP/RFIs that are completed by Cloudflare are consistent and polished in their representation of our services. The role will manage the completion of all RFPs in addition to being responsible for creating and maintaining a database of reusable answers. This role will partner with Sales Leadership, Product Marketing, Product, Communications, and other teams to assist in maintaining brand consistency and technical accuracy in all completed RFPs. This individual will also be expected to support all aspects of the proposal process including writing executive summaries, and assisting in pricing and deal negotiations especially with high-value customers. This role will sit within the Global Sales Operations Team. The ideal candidate thrives in a high-pressure environment, has strong project management skills, and is excited about learning how Cloudflare helps make the Internet work.

Additional responsibilities may include:

Ensure all RFPs are reviewed, approved, and properly documented
Develop robust and repeatable RFP processes; identifying process improvement and sales training opportunities
Build a repository of common questions and answers as a self-service resource for completing RFPs
Work cross-functionally with Sales, Finance, Legal, Compliance, and Security teams
Develop and deliver management reports that synthesize the effectiveness of the pursuit process and its impact on deals. Use techniques such as formal post-deal debriefs and internal/external surveys to identify best practices and areas for refinement

Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience


Bachelor's degree required
5+ years of B2B sales experience. Minimum of 2+ years of Deal support experience
Detail-Oriented while having a good grasp of the end-to-end process
Self-starter with the ability to function independently and in a timely manner
Ability to manage own workload and adjust priorities to work efficiently and meet deadlines
Ability to identify areas of improvement and propose necessary changes
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to operate under pressure/with a sense of urgency
Ability to work non-standard hours, this role will be supporting global RFPs and will sometimes need to work early and/or late hours
Proficiency in Salesforce.com required; experience in additional sales productivity tools or quote to cash systems preferred
Experience with Loopio or similar RFP management tool a plus
Familiarity with SaaS industry a plus
Experience with pricing large SaaS deals

What Makes Cloudflare Special?

We're not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We're a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.

Project Galileo ( https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/ ): We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare's enterprise customers--at no cost.

Project Athenian ( https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/ ): We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.

Path Forward Partnership ( https://blog.cloudflare.com/tag/path-forward/ ): Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.

1.1.1.1 ( https://1.1.1.1/ ): We released1.1.1.1 ( https://1.1.1.1/ ) to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here's the deal - we don't store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by ourprivacy policy ( https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/commitment-to-privacy/privacy-policy/privacy-policy/ ) and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.

Sound like something you'd like to be a part of? We'd love to hear from you!

Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.

Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.

cf1d90f7ff4d3e17.title: Head of Legal
cf1d90f7ff4d3e17.description:
About Pantheon

Pantheon is the only WebOps platform built from the ground up for agility. We help our customers win, where digital experience starts and matters most - their websites. We empower teams of developers, marketers, and IT professionals to focus on delivering business results while Pantheon handles uptime, performance, scalability and security. We are the fastest growing Drupal and WordPress platform in the world, powering over 285,000 sites and serving billions of pages every month. Happy customers include some of the most recognized names in high tech, higher education and NGO, such as Patch, Apigee, UC Berkeley, Arizona State University, and the United Nations.
With 35% of the web running open source, we are growing aggressively into a huge market opportunity and looking to expand our Legal team. That’s where you come in.

The Role

You will be the first legal hire in a fast growing, enterprise Software-as-a-Service company in downtown San Francisco. Reporting to the CFO, your responsibilities will include ownership of all aspects of Pantheon’s negotiations with customers and vendors, instituting compliance policies while maintaining the entrepreneurial culture of the company, oversight of legal operations, and working with outside counsel on all aspects of Intellectual Property, Privacy, employment, and corporate issues.

We are looking for a practical attorney who is interested in learning about our technology, can enable our go-to-market strategy, and will establish her or himself as a trusted business partner to every executive as well as a company-wide thought leader.

Pantheon’s core company values are Trust, Teamwork, Passion, and Customers First. At Pantheon, we work hard and play harder, valuing individuality, humor, and balance. We're enthusiastic participants in several open-source communities and have real relationships with many of our most active customers. If all of this sounds interesting to you, read on!

Cool Things You’ll Do

Collaborate with Pantheon executive team on setting legal priorities for the company and individual functions
Work with Pantheon’s Sales team to negotiate strategic customer contracts, close deals in the most efficient manner, and educate sales representatives to effectively sell Pantheon’s legal terms
Institute company-wide compliance processes for all areas of the business, including privacy, employment practices, vendor relationships, and Intellectual Property management
Design, implement, and oversee processes and technologies for scalable Legal Operations
Protect Pantheon’s Intellectual Property rights and exposure
Address other ad-hoc or specialized legal issues in conjunction with outside counsel
What You Bring To The Table
Relevant experience: Six to eight years of experience in a premier law-firm and / or in-house with experiences in technology companies, privacy policies, and open-source software a plus
Technical skills: High level expertise in the areas of software procurement contracts and privacy
High EQ: Ability to listen and work in concert with counterparties to find mutually agreeable solutions in negotiations;
Structured thinking: Comfort with business metrics and ability to break down complex legal problems into business and legal risks; ability to explain legal issues to business and technology focused partners
Passion: Strong sense of ownership, desire to make a cross-functional impact, eagerness to learn, customer orientation.
Sense of humor
California Bar certification
What We Offer

Fantastic work environment powered by an amazing team
Unlimited vacation
Dog-friendly office (HQ)
Maternity and paternity leave
Monthly gym and book allowance
Fun at WordPress and Drupal community events
Fully loaded kitchen and daily catered lunches (HQ, NY, MN)
Discounts on custom bicycles (the founders of Pantheon also founded Mission Bicycle)
Fast Facts

Pantheon recently closed its Series D funding ($40m) 
Pantheon is one of America’s Best Workplaces of 2019 
Pantheon earns Top 10 Ranking in “Best Software Awards” by G2 Crowd 
Pantheon actively sponsors programs like the Grace Hopper Celebration (GHC 19) 
Pantheon is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

75bb29d0e124db8f.title: Web Developer
75bb29d0e124db8f.description:
At the Pac-12, we love sports and technology! Join our team and you’ll get to work on innovative and creative products that drive the next generation of sports streaming at the Conference of Champions.

In the coming year, Pac-12 will be one of the first sites to launch on the Drupal 9 platform. Can you take our web experience to the next level? We are looking for a full stack developer with exceptional video experience, who will be responsible for the development, maintenance, and integrations of applications and services aimed at a vast audience. Developers on our team have a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and creating quality products.
Responsibilities
Design, build and maintain high performance, reusable, and reliable code
Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of our applications & services
Contribute to the architecture & design of our applications
Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs
Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization
Participate in peer code reviews
Support site operations and respond to performance issues
Requirements
Solid understanding of server-side technologies & development such as PHP, Node.js, MySQL, NoSQL (MongoDB)
Proficiency in core technologies for front-end development (CSS, HTML, and JavaScript).
Able to display 2+ years of in-depth experience with enterprise or high-performance Drupal sites
Comfortable working with React, Video.js and other modern JavaScript libraries
Experience building and consuming RESTful web services.
Knowledge of Drupal’s key APIs
Experience with Drupal 7 & 8
Debugging experience in IE11+, mobile Safari, and more modern browsers.
Familiarity with Git, terminal commands, and project ticketing systems.
Bonus
Experience integrating Adobe Pass with the Primetime Desktop TVSDK.
Knowledge of Audio & Video Transports and Codecs (e.g., MP4, H.264, AVC, HEVC, AV1,
AAC)
Knowledge of Video Streaming using HLS and/or DASH
A knack for benchmarking and optimization
Familiarity with continuous integration
Contributed to Drupal Core and/or Modules
A creative thinker and experienced problem solver with a hunger for knowledge

8c3cda9471be9d40.title: Digital – Sr. Design Technologist
8c3cda9471be9d40.description:
Chase is the U.S. consumer and commercial banking business of JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM), a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.5 trillion and operations worldwide. Chase serves nearly half of America's households with a broad range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. Customers can choose how and where they want to bank: 5,200 branches, 16,000 ATMs, mobile, online and by phone. For more information, go to Chase.com.

Chase is undertaking an aggressive digital transformation agenda, which builds on the success of the current mobile and online service offerings. Chase is investing in innovative ways to deepen customer engagement and profitability through the use of digital channels. The ambition is to position Chase as the undisputed leader in digital financial services and payments to enable Chase to deliver the highly personalized, real time experiences that customers increasingly expect.

Our Design Systems team is adding a Design Technologist. In this role, you will support our multi-brand and multi-platform Design System with the code and tools that help application designers and engineers work better together. Design Systems at Chase is a strategically important effort within the Design and Customer Experience organization, and is staffed by a team of designers, engineers and content experts who share the vision of enabling quality customer experience execution at scale. Your work will have a big impact on our customers, as well as on our geographically diverse teams of application designers and engineers across the company.

You will need strong technical and communication skills along with a customer-centric point of view. The ability to work closely with UX designers, product, researchers, and other engineers to deliver a robust and scalable technology product is critical to your success in this role.

Your role will combine your technical experience in UI development (web or native mobile), general software skills (using tools such as Node, git, and Jenkins), and knowledge of the UX design process to bring our design principles to life through reusable components that span designer tools and engineering code. You’ll need a strong ability to look beyond immediate requirements to anticipate how your work could be useful or limiting in alternate scenarios. You’ll need to be a strong leader, with the ability to influence and guide teammates and stakeholders in the creation of reusable solutions that align with established design and engineering standards, or lead the creation of new standards.

Your ideas and efforts will have a direct influence on the design of applications that reach over 50 million JPMorgan Chase customers.

Responsibilities:
Work with designers and other engineers to build state-of-the-art design tooling, code artifacts and component libraries for a multi-brand, multi-platform Design System.
Help define the best way to increase the visibility, usefulness and maintainability of design artifacts as well as UI component code artifacts.
Deliver both production-quality and proof-of-concept code in a variety of frameworks and tools.
Own the stability of shipped tools and libraries.
Work with technical writers to create documentation and training resources.
·

Qualifications

3+ years of work experience writing and releasing UI libraries or application UIs on top of Node, iOS, Android or other stacks, complete with test automation, CI integration, developer documentation and versioning / publishing controls.
Knowledge of design team techniques and tools such as Sketch (preferred), InVision, UXPin and others. Experience writing plugins for design tools is a strong plus.
Experience with popular component technologies such as Web Components (preferred) or React. Strong experience styling components on the web (using CSS), iOS and/or Android, especially in a multi-brand/themed environment.
Strong understanding of continuous integration principles, functional testing and source control using Git.
Experience working in an Agile development team.
History of success creating and deploying enterprise level software

c589da9231aa5359.title: User Experience Designer - Developer Experience
c589da9231aa5359.description:
Ability to go beyond the data to develop core insights about user behavior and understanding. Skills to transform these insights into actionable product and design outcomesPossess excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills; have the ability to communicate abstract concepts clearly and confidently across different audiences and varying levels of the organization3+ years experience crafting powerful product design stories and conducting research on desktop, mobile and cloud-based projects. A passion for the video game design, and/or experience in the gaming industry is a huge plus

Are you passionate about user-centered design? Do you love to understand customers - their mindset, perceptions, needs, and habits? The Developer Experience Design team at Twitch is seeking a strong, motivated User Experience Designer to provide guidance and insight into our products, platforms, and development communities.

In this job, you will play a critical role in uncovering key user insights and translating those insights into actionable, meaningful insights for the product, bridging the gap between research and design. As a team, we will lean into the value of these insights to further grow our customer-centric process and build experiences that delight our viewers, broadcasters, and developers alike.

You will be involved in every step of the design process, from project definition and discovery, to user testing the concepts you create and working with engineering to ensure the final product meets the design bar.

Responsibilities
Lead a hypothesis-driven approach to determine product-market fit of new and existing DX solutions, iterating constantly throughout the entire design and development cycleTake full ownership of the cross-platform user experience for projects from start to finish, including wireframes, mockups, and prototypesManage your own process: Identify and execute on high-impact projects, triage external requests, and bring projects to conclusion in time for the results to be usefulWork hand-in-hand across all disciplines of design, product management, engineering, data science, leadership, and planning

Familiarity with Twitch, its platforms, services, and communityUnderstanding of developer communities within the software or product spaceExperience with web analytics and/or software instrumentation/ data visualizationFormal degree in Design, Interaction/UX Design, human-computer interaction, or a related discipline

590892c8f38aec52.title: Full Stack Engineer
590892c8f38aec52.description:
ClimateAI is a mission-driven for-profit venture, currently in stealth mode, trying to mobilize CEOs of Fortune 500 companies and their investors to make more responsible decisions. We use AI to predict the risk of climate change on specific assets and use this info to help design climate resilient strategies for CEOs and investors. We just raised our pre-series-A financing round led by some of the biggest names in the venture capital industry including Jerry Yang, the founder of yahoo. The company was founded at Stanford University and the CEO has worked with Vice President Al Gore. We’re looking for a smart, passionate, team-oriented full-stack engineer to join our team.
About the role:
We are a values driven company that provides a supportive environment where you can do your best work, where creativity and personal initiative are cherished, where product quality standards are nothing short of excellent, and where you have a direct, leading role in delighting customers.
As a full stack engineer at ClimateAI, you can expect to:
Build high-impact features that will enable data analytics and assist knowledge discovery.
Design, build and optimize large-scale data processing pipeline that powers our deep learning models and in-house analytics system
Work closely with our clients to build, integrate and customize APIs that meet their requirements
Instrument, automate, and optimize our infrastructure for reliability, scalability, and developer productivity
Evaluate and deploy new technology, tools, and processes to the team; uphold and improve our engineering standards
Work with the COO/CSO on the product strategy and tech roadmap.

Requirements:
2+ full-time years experience as a full stack engineer
You are passionate about working with a small team in a fast-paced environment, with a sense of ownership and a strong desire to make an impact.
You take pride in wearing multiple hats by navigating through a stack of technologies and products
Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks such as Angular JS, React and Amber
Intermediate to advanced understanding of Python
Experience with AWS
Experience with developing APIs with developer-friendly interface and documentation
Bonus: knowledge of Machine Learning algorithms, Docker or other container orchestration platforms.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Focus: AI to help design climate resilient strategies
Founded: 2017
Employees: 1-10
Business Type: Private
Office Location: San Francisco, CA
Compensation: In line with the best standards of Silicon Valley for both cash and equity
How to apply:
Submit a resume and cover letter to borna@climate.ai. Please include any relevant links to personal web pages, LinkedIn, Github, or similar platforms.

0e30b3e0d13d2d39.description:

This is a hands-on, highly technical position is for someone who can dive deep, build complex, AWS-optimized architectures, and develop a long-term strategy with AWS business development and service teams.

Candidates must have great communication skills and be very technical, with the ability to impress AWS customers at any level, from executive to developer. e9956c4b5bf12960.title: Senior Full Stack Web Developer
e9956c4b5bf12960.description:
To be considered for this position, please apply directly using this link: https://grnh.se/efee0ded1

At Meraki, we’re making IT easier, faster, and smarter. Our full stack teams build and maintain our web application, which manages millions of network devices from our cloud. Our customers use the Meraki dashboard to monitor and configure critical IT infrastructure that serves tens of millions of people every single day.

As a Meraki Full Stack Engineer on a product team, you will collaborate with firmware engineers to design, plan, and build new features for our customers. With the help of product managers and UX designers, you will construct intuitive and powerful workflows to solve important problems for IT professionals around the world.

Meraki’s product Dashboard teams are small, fast-moving teams striving to make our products unique in balancing their feature-rich abilities and their simplicity. You’ll be developing the tools by which our customers configure and monitor network devices all over the world. Our full stack engineers are well versed in a wide array of CS concepts and excited to jump around languages, platforms, and all levels of the Meraki stack!

Example projects of a Senior Full Stack Web Developer:
Creating a Security Center summarizing a customer’s network security events and attacker locations and highlighting actionable events.
Analyzing performance bottlenecks in generating device configuration for customers with many 1000s of devices and rearchitecting this code to be scalable.
Designing a firewall page that unifies across a customer’s security appliances, access points, and switches.
You are an ideal candidate if you:
Have built rich web UIs with React (and Redux) or similar frameworks.
Know your way around web back-end technologies, like Ruby on Rails.
Can implement good database design in a relational database (we use Postgres).
Would thrive on a small engineering team and are excited to solve open-ended problems across the stack.
Are interested in career advancement. We're looking for leaders, whether that means you want to be a strong leading individual contributor or you want to grow into a tech lead role.
Bonus points for any of the following:
An understanding of networking, which will help you understand the problems we work on and develop the best tools for our customers.

Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

To be considered for this position, please apply directly using this link: https://grnh.se/efee0ded1

1baac34d4513b118.title: Hybrid Cloud Software Systems Engineer
1baac34d4513b118.description:
Introduction
Software Developers at IBM are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to design, code, test, and provide industry-leading solutions that literally make the world run today - planes and trains take off on time, bank transactions complete in the blink of an eye and the world remains safe because of the work our software developers do. Whether you are working on projects internally or for a client, software development is critical to the success of IBM and our clients worldwide. At IBM, you will use latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of.

Your Role and Responsibilities
Software Systems Engineers in IBM Cloud & Cognitive Software design, build and deploy complex and highly reliable applications and services to provide optimum integration into Enterprise IT systems, with capabilities to create a dedicated instance for each customer.

Who We Are
Our patented, Emmy® award-winning FASP™ protocol is at the core of next-generation transport technologies that move the world’s data at maximum speed regardless of file size, transfer distance and network conditions. Originally conceptualized and developed by the legacy Aspera organization, this offering fully utilizes existing infrastructures to deliver the fastest, most predictable file-transfer experience. Integrated with IBM's enterprise capabilities, the result is unprecedented control over bandwidth, complete security and uncompromising reliability.

Whom We're Seeking
Our software stack contains web services across a variety of frameworks as well as native and Go-based applications. As a high-speed data transfer service, we are seeking an Development Engineer eager to solve unique problems in Kubernetes networking, scaling, and reliability. The ideal candidate will also be familiar with the "day-two problems" of development operations (aka DevOps), visibility and support; and understands best practices around these problems.

What You'll Do
Expand existing build pipelines to increase supported platforms
Contribute to the design of innovative solutions to hybrid cloud problems on IBM Cloud Private
Build dashboards and enhancing system visibility with Prometheus, Grafana, and Kibana
Create and enhance Helm charts for service description and repeatable deployments
Migrate existing Helm based deployments to use Operators
Work on projects focused on porting existing workloads to microservices and containers

Who You Are
You apply creativity and judgment to your developmental work on different projects and jump at the chance to share your findings to make those around you better at what they do. You recognize complex problems related to functional objectives quickly, analyze situations and implement solutions to fix them. We believe you are a good fit for this role if you:
Are passionate about and possess experience crafting technology solutions and eliminating mundane and repetitive work
Understand security models
Are a systematic problem solver at heart, agile and adaptable in changing priorities
Have experience running native code on a hybrid cloud platform
Have never encountered a deadline you couldn’t meet

Who You’ll Work With
You’ll have the opportunity to work with a dynamic and independent team of engineers and other functions such as User Experience Design, Architecture, Data Science, QA, Product Management and Delivery to design and develop advanced capabilities. We come to work thrilled knowing it will never be the same day twice. This variety enables us to be innovative convergent thinkers who juggle challenging requirements with agility.

Today’s operating environment demands a stack that’s responsive to the innovative enterprise – one that can demonstrate all data types & access the latest technologies. By 2020, businesses will contribute at least 50% of IT spend on cloud. Be part of a diverse and global team of thinkers and doers - people who want to make an impact, nurture their expertise and collaborate with some of the world’s top business and technology professionals. We’re hiring...JOIN US.

Keywords
#swdev #docker #PaaS @IBMCloud #kubernetes #devops #security #SDLC #nativecode #golang #CICD @caffeinate_adam #highspeedtransfer #SCRUM #IBMToday #SaaS @IBMNAJobs #API #collaboration #fasp


Required Professional and Technical Expertise
In addition to your strong written and verbal communication skills, you'll possess at least three (3) years' experience....
Running and monitoring production workloads on a container orchestration platform
Continuous Integration/Delivery experience with one or more of the following (Jenkins, Gitlab CI, Travis)
Working or familiarity with Kubernetes networking model, including ingress patterns

Preferred Professional and Technical Expertise
5+ years' experience in both development and DevOps roles
5+ years' experience with Kubernetes networking model, including ingress patterns
Experience working in a private cloud environment
Strong knowledge of linux systems and security models
Grasp of advanced networking concepts, including routing, service discovery, and load balancing
Experience deploying and running highly available cloud services
Running and monitoring production workloads on a container orchestration platform (Kubernetes, Marathon, Aurora)
Experience building for non-x86 architectures is a plus (Linux on Z, PowerLinux)
Understanding of threat modeling and security best practices

About Business Unit
Digitization is accelerating the ongoing evolution of business, and clouds - public, private, and hybrid - enable companies to extend their existing infrastructure and integrate across systems. IBM Cloud provides the security, control, and visibility that our clients have come to expect. We are working to provide the right tools and environment to combine all of our client’s data, no matter where it resides, to respond to changing market dynamics.

Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world. What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location Statement
We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

28bfc562ae4ec0ca.title: MEAN Stack Developer
28bfc562ae4ec0ca.description:
MEAN Stack Developer
San Jose, CA
About the role. . .
We are looking for a MEAN Stack Developer to join our San Jose, CA based team to work with cutting-edge technologies and interesting companies in a wide variety of fast-paced and exciting environments. The MEAN stack developer is responsible for all aspects of the software development life-cycle, which includes estimating, technical design, implementation, documentation, testing, deployment and support of innovative applications developed for our clients. You will team with solution architects and developers on the translation of wire-frames and creative designs into functional requirements, and subsequently into technical design. The ideal candidate will have a customer-first mindset and focus on what is possible vs. what is standard practice in the industry. They will have excellent product instincts, passion for great app experiences, a data-centric mindset, and the willingness to do what it takes to have a positive impact on our customers.
About You. . .
Customer-obsessed; you care about and understand the customer needs and focus on driving product requirements that align to them
Demonstrated ability to lead projects from concept to delivery by working closely with back-end and front-end developers
Consistently ensure web standards are met and platforms are fully functional before delivery to clients
Have a strong passion for mobile apps and emerging technologies
Proven expertise in industry SDLC best practices and delivery excellence
Ability to roll up sleeves and immerse in the details
Results focused
Qualifications: Required:
5+ years of software development experience with a track record of shipping highly scalable, cross-platform products
5+ years of experience in technical architecture of web applications and/or media products
5+ years of experience creating examples through wire-frames and mock-ups
Excellent hands-on design, coding, testing methodologies and debugging skills
Solid Java, JavaScript, HTML/HTML5, Handlebar/Backbone/ReactJS experience with MVC or component-based UI frameworks, Spring Boot
Strong proficiency with AngularJS, NodeJS, Java or .Net
Preferred:
MongoDB, Express.JS
Proven experience with rapid, iterative design and development processes
Launched product experiences into consumer-facing web and/or mobile applications
Prior experience working in an Agile development process
Strong communication and presentation skills
Ability to drive projects to timely completion
Experienced in identifying the business and technical impacts of requirements
Deep understanding of Service Oriented Architectures, Domain Driven Design concepts
Demonstrated experience developing solutions with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and/or other relevant Cloud Infrastructure solutions like Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud
Experience working with high-volume streaming systems (Apache Kafka/Kinesis)
Experience working with geographically distributed teams
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or professional certifications in computer technology
About Logic20/20. . .
Logic20/20 is one of Seattle’s fastest growing full-service consulting firms. Our core competency is creating simplicity and efficiency in complex solutions. Although we make it look like magic, we succeed by combining methodical and structured approaches with our substantial experience to design elegant solutions for even the most intricate challenges. Our rapid growth is in response to our ability to deliver consistently for our clients, which is directly related to the quality of the people we hire.
The past three years, we’ve been in the top 10 “Best Companies to Work For” ….. why? Our team members are highly self-motivated, comfortable conceiving strategies on the fly, and enjoy working both individually and as part of a team. Our environment is very high-energy and demanding, and individuals with remarkable enthusiasm and a can-do attitude are joining our team. We have lots of fun, focus on our employees and our clients, and work to bring our best to every opportunity.

0b786dbfcc53eb5b.title: Salesforce and Web Developer/Administrator
0b786dbfcc53eb5b.description:
Salesforce and Web Developer/Administrator

Calypso is looking for an Salesforce and Web Developer / Administrator to focus on the development of Salesforce Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system as well as other corporate applications.

The Developer is responsible for implementing, maintaining, testing, and deploying solutions, using Apex and Visualforce, PHP, MYSQL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX, LAMP stack and other technologies.

The Developer must be able to communicate well with user groups who have varying technical abilities. Quality is key, as is an ability to understand user requirements and translate them into a technical reality that is extendable and maintainable.

To succeed in this role, you must be able to work directly with the platform, diagnose and resolve technical issues, and implement customized applications. You must be motivated, a self–starter, detail oriented, have excellent problem-solving skills, and take ownership of work. You must thrive on working with complex problems and finding and creating simple solutions that address business needs.
Responsibilities:

Design and write web applications using appropriate methods and technology

Handle daily bug fixes and problems as they come up

Participate in releasing code and perform code reviews

Assist in server maintenance and setup

Build efficient, testable, and reusable PHP modules

Work with Apex, Visualforce, PHP, MYSQL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX, LAMP stack and other technologies.


Salesforce Administration to Manage Users, Workflow, planning, and budgeting processes used within the sales organization.


Design and develop Salesforce-based applications and enhancements


Understand and leverage the Salesforce provided APIs

Review and understand business requirements and create functional prototypes to address them

Follow established Salesforce development standards and best practices

Stay current on Force.com technology changes and Salesforce releases

Work in an agile manner; be flexible to changing priorities

Design, develop, test, document, and deploy high quality business solutions on the Force.com platform

Communicate with user groups regarding status, technical issues and creative solutions.

Engage in the planning and implementation of project

Effectively manage resources, scheduling and deliverables through the entire project life cycle

Support to project team members

Constantly monitor and report on progress of the project to all stakeholders

Ensure that issues are escalated and flagged immediately

Develop basic training tools for end users

Other duties as assigned by management.

Qualifications:

Strong knowledge of PHP web frameworks
Understanding the fully synchronous behavior of PHP

Understanding of MVC design patterns

Knowledge of object oriented PHP programming

Strong knowledge of the common PHP or web server exploits and their solutions

Minimum of 3 years of experience developing Force.com commercial business applications as part of a collaborative team

Experience with Salesforce.com Web Services APIs - Force.com SOAP and REST-based Web Service APIs, the Bulk API, and the Metadata API

Experience working with Force.com application packaging and deployment is a plus

Experience developing interactive web-based applications

Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

Salesforce.com Developer certification is strongly preferred

Familiarity with web/database application development technologies like PHP,SQL, JavaScript, AJAX, JSON, HTML5 and CSS is preferred

Proficiency in developing in Force.com Visual Force pages, Managed Packages, and integration to other third party solutions

Experience integrating Salesforce with 3rd party system using web services and app exchange apps


Calypso’s Rewarding Careers

Since our founding in 1997, Calypso has been the leader of innovation in capital markets technology. To continue our track record of growth we need the best talent from across the globe and offer outstanding opportunities to join a uniquely innovative, highly successful company that straddles the worlds of technology and finance. With over 20 offices worldwide, market leading products and a customer base of the world’s top banks, asset managers, hedge funds and insurers our team thrives on stimulating challenges and global opportunities.

Your Calypso Career

We are growing our team by recruiting and hiring the best talent in the market - those who desire to take the initiative, are self-directed learners and have the desire solve our customers’ problems to drive our growth. Also, we identify, train and develop future leaders to ensure we have the capabilities to scale the business and to provide career development to our team members.

At Calypso, you will have an active role in a business that makes a difference in the capital markets every day. Regardless of your role, your work will be closely tied to our customers’ success and will have an impact on their mission critical systems.

If you have the drive, a winning attitude and a desire to make a difference then we invite you to apply today.

Calypso Technology is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and strongly supports diversity in the workforce.

Calypso only accepts resumes from approved agencies who have a valid executed Non-Exclusive Master Staffing Agency Agreement on file. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, Calypso employees, or send to any Calypso location. Calypso is not responsible for any fees or claims related to receipt of unsolicited resumes.
